Description: Marl pottery vase with ovoid body, two pierced tubular handles and flat ledge rim; decorated in red paint with vertical panels filled with 3-4 horizontal wavy lines creating a checkerboard pattern. A spiral is painted on the base.
Curator's comments: Most similar to Decorated ware D12H in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: good, rim top worn by salt.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
